greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiples of 12 and odd numbers interleaved.
comment: Partial sums give the generalized 16-gonal numbers (A274978).
a(n) is also the length of the n-th line segment of the rectangular spiral whose vertices are the generalized 16-gonal numbers.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,0,-1).
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[x (1 + 12 x + x^2)/((1 - x)^2*(1 + x)^2), {x, 0, 69}], x] (* or *)
xref: Sequences whose partial sums give the generalized k-gonal numbers: A026741 (k=5), A001477 (k=6), zero together with A080512 (k=7), A022998 (k=8), A195140 (k=9), zero together with A165998 (k=10), A195159 (k=11), A195161 (k=12), A195312 k=13), A195817 (k=14), A317311 (k=15).
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 25 2018
